intro: Leandra velutina, commonly known as the velvet leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
